subject: Web3
title: The Environmental Criticism
description: A 60-second lesson on The Environmental Criticism.

hook.text: In 2021, minting a single NFT on Ethereum used as much energy as a household uses in two days.

buildup.text: Artists who championed sustainability faced backlash for selling NFTs on an energy-intensive blockchain.

discovery.text: Entire movements formed against NFTs. The hashtag #CleanNFT pushed for lower-energy alternatives.

twist.text: When Ethereum switched to proof of stake in 2022, its energy use dropped 99.95%. The argument mostly evaporated.

climax.text: The environmental debate shaped how NFTs were perceived publicly. The damage to the narrative lasted even after the fix.

punchline.text: The energy problem was real. Then Ethereum fixed it. The stigma stayed.

quiz.question: How did Ethereum address the NFT energy criticism?
options: It switched to proof of stake, cutting energy 99.95%
